parameters.description: This is the main parameter block.

payload.name: gain_setting
payload.description: Analog gain setting (0 = low, 1 = normal, 2 = high)

payload.name: interval
payload.description: Time interval between individual signal intensity samples in 25nsec increments (40 to 40000 == 1 microsecond to 1000 microseconds)

payload.name: number_of_samples
payload.description: Number of samples per reflected signal

device_data.description: This message is used to communicate the current sonar state. If the data field is populated, the other fields indicate the sonar state when the data was captured. The time taken before the response to the command is sent depends on the difference between the last angle scanned and the new angle in the parameters as well as the number of samples and sample interval (range). To allow for the worst case reponse time the command timeout should be set to 4000 msec.

payload.name: gain_setting
payload.description: Analog gain setting (0 = low, 1 = normal, 2 = high)

payload.name: interval
payload.description: Time interval between individual signal intensity samples in 25nsec increments (40 to 40000 == 1 microsecond to 1000 microseconds)

payload.name: number_of_samples
payload.description: Number of samples per reflected signal

payload.name: data
payload.description: 8 bit binary data array representing sonar echo strength

reset.description: Reset the sonar. The bootloader may run depending on the selection according to the `bootloader` payload field. When the bootloader runs, the external LED flashes at 5Hz. If the bootloader is not contacted within 3 seconds, it will run the current program. If there is no program, then the bootloader will wait forever for a connection.

transducer.description: The transducer will move to the selected angle. The sonar will reply with a `ping360_data` message. If the `transmit` field is 0, the sonar will not transmit after locating the transducer, and the `data` field in the `ping360_data` message reply will be empty. If the `transmit` field is 1, the sonar will make an acoustic transmission after locating the transducer, and the resulting data will be uploaded in the `data` field of the `ping360_data` message reply. To allow for the worst case reponse time the command timeout should be set to 4000 msec.

payload.name: angle
payload.description: Head angle in gradians (0 to 399 gradians).

payload.name: transmit
payload.description: 0 = do not transmit; 1 = transmit after the transducer has reached the specified angle
